required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Lyophilized Food Extracts for Skin Prick Tests and Atopy Patch Test at Different Storage Time
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Skin Prick Tests and Atopy Patch Test Results of Lyophilized Food Extracts at Different Storage Time (0, 3 and 6 Months) After Preparation

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison the result of skin prick tests and atopy patch test of lyophilized food extracts at different storage time (0, 3 and 6 months) after preparation

detailed_description.textblock:
Skin prick test were performed with lyophilized food extracts (cow milk, egg white, egg yolk, wheat, soy and shrimp) at different storage time (0, 3 and 6 months) after preparation.
Atopy patch test were performed with lyophilized food extracts (cow milk, egg white, egg yolk, wheat, soy and shrimp) at different storage time (0, 3 and 6 months) after preparation

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Perform skin prick test and atopy patch test of lyophilized foods (cow milk, egg white, egg yolk, wheat, soy and shrimp) stored at different time; 0, 3 and 6 months after preparation. Then compare the results.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: skin test result of lyophilized foods at 6 months after preparation
primary_outcome.description: Perform skin prick test and atopy patch test the patients with lyophilized foods at 0, 3 and 6 months after preparation and compare the results at 6 months to 0 and 3 months.

arm_group.description: the skin test results of food extract at time 0 months after preparation
the skin test results of food extract at time 3 months after preparation
the skin test results of food extract at time 6 months after preparation

intervention.intervention_name: skin test with food at different storage times
intervention.description: Perform skin tests to each foods at 0, 3, 6 months after preparation and compare the results

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- mild to moderately severe food allergy patients
- At least positive skin test to one kind of common food (commercial extract)
- Stop antihistamine or corticosteroid (if more than 20mg/day) for at least 7 days
Exclusion Criteria:
- Dermographism
- Severe systemic disease such as autoimmune disease, immune deficiency, malignancy
- Severe dermatitis or large area involment
- pregnancy

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Pediatrics, Siriraj hospital, Mahidol University
